articles.title: Swiss Delegation Visits DPRK
articles.content:
Swiss Delegation Visits DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- A Swiss delegation of the Geneva Centre for Security Policy headed by Alain Guidetti, advisor of the Regional Development Programme, visited the DPRK from October 12 to 16 at the invitation of the Disarmament and Peace Institute of the DPRK Foreign Ministry.
					 During the stay, the delegation exchanged views on the issues of mutual concern such as the situation of the Korean peninsula at talks with officials of the Disarmament and Peace Institute and the Academy of Social Sciences. And it visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, and toured various places including the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum and the Sci-Tech Complex.

articles.title: 28th National Exhibition of Consumer Goods Opens
articles.content:
28th National Exhibition of Consumer Goods Opens
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- The 28th National Exhibition of Consumer Goods opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Underground Shop on Monday.
					 Presented to it are more than 80 000 consumer goods of 2 000 varieties produced at light industrial factories and daily necessity production units under ministries and national institutions.
					
					 During the exhibition there will be visits to such factories as Rangnang Disabled Soldiers' Essential Plastic Goods Factory, workshop on new technologies and registration of February 2 goods.
					
					 Among those present at the opening ceremony were Vice-Premier Ri Ju O, Jo Yong Chol, minister of Food and Consumer Goods Industries, and officials concerned.
					
					 The exhibition will last till Oct. 20.

articles.title: Int'l Sci-tech Exhibition of Furniture and Building Materials Opens
articles.content:
Int'l Sci-tech Exhibition of Furniture and Building Materials Opens
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang international sci-tech exhibition of furniture and building materials opened at the Sci-Tech Complex on Monday.
					 On display in the exhibition hall are items of furniture of great utility and green and functional construction materials presented by more than 100 organizations of the DPRK and other countries and regions.
					
					 Attending the opening ceremony were officials, researchers and teachers of the Capital City Construction Commission, the Ministry of Construction and Building-Materials Industry and other commissions, ministries and national institutions, scientific and educational institutions and relevant units and delegations of foreign countries and regions and members of foreign diplomatic missions here.
					
					 Choe Jong Ho, president of the Sci-Tech Complex, made an opening address and Sim Yong Hak, chairman of the Central Committee of the Architects Union of Korea, made a congratulatory speech.
					
					 They said that the exhibition would be helpful to exchanging the scientific and technological successes and experience gained in the fields of furniture and building materials, boosting the friendship and cooperation among countries and encouraging the development of new technologies and products.
					
					 The exhibition will last till Oct. 20.

articles.title: World Food Day Observed Here
articles.content:
World Food Day Observed Here
Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- An event took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club here on Monday to mark World Food Day.
					Present there were Vice-Minister of Agriculture Ko Myong Hui and officials of ministries, national institutions and relevant units, Tapan Mishra, UN resident coordinator and UNDP resident representative, Bir Chandra Mandal, deputy representative of FAO, and staff members of FAO and WFP missions and foreign embassies here.
					
					Speeches were made there.
					
					Speakers referred to the theme of World Food Day this year, saying that this event would be a good occasion in discussing the measures to meet the daily growing demand for food in a sustainable way.
					
					They noted that the DPRK set it as a top-priority task to solve the food problem, concentrating all efforts it.
					
					They stressed the need to further boost exchange and cooperation with international bodies and organizations in the field of agricultural production.
					
					Prior to the event, members of the missions of FAO, UNDP, WFP and WHO did assistance work on a farm around Pyongyang on the occasion of World Food Day.

articles.title: Autumn Amateur Riders Competition Takes Place
articles.content:
Autumn Amateur Riders Competition Takes Place
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- The autumn amateur riders competition took place at the Mirim Riding Club on Sunday under the sponsorship of the Korean Riding Association.
					 Among the spectators were amateurs and citizens.
					
					 The competition brought together members of the association and amateurs.
					
					 It was held, divided into horse riding amusement game, equestrian skills game and amateurs' race.
					
					 At the end of the competition, a lottery for race of horse riders of the club took place.

articles.title: Delegation of Russian Social Body Arrives Here
articles.content:
Delegation of Russian Social Body Arrives Here
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Russian Committee to Praise the Great Persons of Mt Paektu led by Chairman V. A. Petrov came here Monday.
					 Earlier, arriving was Jin Yuhua, director of the Board of Directors of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation.

articles.title: Home-Visiting Groups of Koreans in Japan Here
articles.content:
Home-Visiting Groups of Koreans in Japan Here
Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Home-visiting groups of Koreans in Japan headed by Choe Jae Bong and Si Song Ji arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Home-visiting Groups of Koreans in Japan Pay Tribute to Great Leaders
articles.content:
Home-visiting Groups of Koreans in Japan Pay Tribute to Great Leaders
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Home-visiting groups of Korean residents in Japan visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Monday.
					 They placed bunches of flowers at the statues before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK Students Prove Successful at Int'l Program Contests
articles.content:
DPRK Students Prove Successful at Int'l Program Contests
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Students at Kim Il Sung University in the DPRK won five consecutive victories at the Codchef Internet program contest this year.
					 In particular, Choe Kwang got 1,000 points, the highest mark, at the contest held on March 3-13 with the attendance of over 7,280 rivals from 70-odd countries like Germany, the U.S. and the UK.
					
					 Choe Song Yong and Ri Myong Hyok also took the first place at the contests held in February, May and August.
					
					 Students of the university have participated in the Codechef contest since 2013, winning its title 16 times.
					
					 Their success is a clear manifestation of validity and vitality of the educational policy of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian Personage
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian Personage
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from a Nigerian personage on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and its 72nd birthday.
					 The gift was conveyed to the DPRK ambassador to Nigeria by Senator Abudulah Adamu, chairman of the Senate commission for Agriculture and Rural Development, on Oct. 9.

articles.title: DPRK Embassy in Moscow Hosts Reception
articles.content:
DPRK Embassy in Moscow Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Moscow hosted a reception on October 12 on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
					 Present there on invitation were figures of the government, political parties, organizations and bodies including the RussiaÔºçDPRK Friendship Parliamentary Group of the State Duma, the Foreign Ministry, the Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the  Moscow Peace Fund, Center for Energy and Security Studies, the  Institute of the Far East of the Russian Academy of Science and the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK.
					
					 Present there were the DPRK ambassador to Russia and his embassy members.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the picture depicting President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il  standing together and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They looked round photos dealing with the exploits of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.
					
					 Meanwhile, a Korean book and photo exhibition, film show and reception took place in Vladivostok on the same day.

articles.title: Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show Takes Place
articles.content:
Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show Takes Plac
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Koreans in China held a Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia show from October 10 to 12 on the occasion of the 72nd founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Present at the show were Koreans in China including a vice-chairperson of the General Association of Koreans in China, the chief of the Hunchun city branch of the association, the DPRK consul general in Shenyang and officials of the consulate general, members of the DPRK branches staying in Hunchun City and Tumen City and those concerned of China.
					
					 Yang Hong Jun, Korean in China, made an opening address.
					
					 Yang referred to how the show was held with splendor on the occasion of the 72nd founding anniversary of the WPK.
					
					 Yang said that through the show he wished Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia be in fuller bloom not only in Hunchun but also in other places of the world.
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were made there.
					
					 Speakers called for more dynamically coming out in the struggle for the prosperity and reunification of the country true to the leadership of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, holding in high esteem President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il as the eternal sun along with Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia.

articles.title: Fishing Boats Built in DPRK
articles.content:
Fishing Boats Built in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Scores of modern fishing boats have been built by the fishery sector of the DPRK in recent several months.
					 Workers and scientists at the Tanchon and Hongwon dockyards built "Hwanggumhae"-class fishing boats in a short span of time by introducing advanced methods.
					
					 The Jongju, Hanchon and Unjon fishery stations have laid down fishing boats equipped with modern shoal detector and fishing tackles.
					
					 According to Ri Kang Chol, an official of the Ministry of Fisheries, those fishing boats built by dockyards and fishery stations across the country are making good hauls.

articles.title: U.S. Withdrawal from UNESCO under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Withdrawal from UNESCO under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- The U.S. recently decided to leave UNESCO (the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization), since the U.S. owes the organization hundreds of millions of US dollars and the body is getting more critical of Israel. This is the height of the extreme U.S.-style egoism, arrogance and immorality, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary, adding:
					 Now the U.S. is making much trouble in the planet while resorting to wars and man-killing in different parts of the world and threatening and blackmailing other countries. Not content with this, it withdrew from UNESCO. Therefore it is left without any justification to talk about international peace, security and civilization.
					
					 The fanatic idea and forces disturbing global peace and civilization and threatening existence of human being have no qualification to exist in the civilized society of mankind and so they should be expelled from it.
					
					 All the countries of the world desirous of independence, justice, peace and development should never allow high-handed and arbitrary practice of the U.S. unhesitatingly committing all kinds of evils under the slogan of "America first".
					
					 Nothing can justify the U.S. withdrawal from UNESCO.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Intensifying Anti-U.S. Education
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Intensifying Anti-U.S. Education
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Transparent anti-U.S. class consciousness of all the servicepersons and people of the DPRK is a powerful ideological weapon helping accelerate the final victory of the revolution, while smashing the reckless nuclear war moves, sanctions and blockade of the U.S., the empire of evil, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an editorial.
					 In the decades-long standoff with the U.S imperialists, the army and people of the DPRK could win one victory after another as they have been equipped with anti-U.S. class consciousness, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 Now that the DPRK has risen up to be the nuclear power of Juche and the world's military power, the U.S. imperialists think that it is impossible to realize its wild ambition for supremacy in Northeast Asia. Therefore, they are making desperate efforts to deprive the DPRK of its sovereignty, right to existence and development.
					
					 If anti-U.S. class consciousness is paralyzed among the younger generations, the revolution would be left unfinished and the whole nation would be slave of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 It is the indomitable spirit and heroic stamina of all the service personnel and people of the DPRK to react to the homicidal U.S. imperialists' rifle with an artillery piece and their psychological warfare with the revolutionary offensive.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are, among other things, afraid of the ideological and moral strength of the army and people of the DPRK equipped with transparent class consciousness against the U.S.
					
					 The editorial calls upon the entire army and people to equip themselves with transparent anti-U.S. class consciousness and work hard to bring earlier the final victory in the anti-U.S. standoff and construction of a socialist power.

articles.title: Sanctions Are Incompatible with Dialogue: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Sanctions Are Incompatible with Dialogue: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun in an article Monday condemns the south Korean puppet forces for crying out again for "simultaneously pushing ahead with the sanctions and pressure and the dialogue" under the pretext of "settlement of the north's nuclear issue", zealously following the Trump group's vicious hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 This is nothing but nonsense of confrontational fanatics not understanding the strategic position of the DPRK which has access to even H-bomb and the changed reality.
					
					 Sanctions are incompatible with dialogue.
					
					 The theory of "simultaneously pushing ahead with the sanctions and pressure and the dialogue" touted by the puppet forces is a replica of the vicious policy towards the DPRK billed war maniac Trump's "maximum pressure and engagement".
					
					 The puppet forces are foolish enough to follow the policy of the master which is the height of Yankee arrogance and double-dealing and to regard it as the key to the issue.
					
					 They seek dialogue and contact aimed at disarming the DPRK. It is a daydream.
					
					 The DPRK is bolstering up a powerful war deterrent for the defense of the state. This is an irretrievable and essential, strategic option.
					
					 The group of traitors can never be pardoned as they are running amuck to wrest the nuclear treasured sword from the DPRK, blindly toeing the line of their American master, failing to understand how the peace on the Korean peninsula has been defended.
					
					 It is disgusting for the present puppet ruling forces of south Korea to talk about north-south dialogue while currying favor with the old lunatic Trump who cried out for "destroying" the Korean nation, and repeating the crimes of the conservatives who got frantic with nuclear war move against the north with the back of foreign forces.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Japan's Intention of Fanning up U.S. War Hysteria
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Japan's Intention of Fanning up U.S. War Hysteria
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. Department of State decided to sell "AIM-12OC-7" missiles worth 113 million dollars to Japan.
					 Meanwhile, Chief Cabinet Secretary Suga and Defense Minister Onodera of Japan trumpeted about "missile threat" from the DPRK, inspecting the units of the "Self-Defense Forces" operating PAC-3 interceptor missile system.
					
					 Commenting on the facts, Rodong Sinmun Monday says:
					
					 Japan's allegation that it will cope with it if the DPRK's ballistic missile and its components fall on its land is tantamount to a noise making the world laugh.
					
					 What matters is that the Japanese reactionaries' heedless acts are adding to the danger of nuclear war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Trump let loose a torrent of unheard-of rubbish against the DPRK, regardless of occasion and place, only putting the situation of the peninsula on the threshold of a nuclear war.
					
					 Huge nuclear war hardware of the U.S. including nuclear carrier strike groups, nuclear submarines and nuclear strategic bombers are amassed to the Korean peninsula in the wake of the remarks of the old lunatic.
					
					 Japan is directly and indirectly abetting the war hysteria of its master, a psychopath.
					
					 Its aim is to drive the situation into the outbreak of war by constantly upsetting the old lunatic Trump without an elementary discrimination. It is the cunning trick of the Japanese reactionaries to catch fish in troubled waters for its ambition for militarism.
					
					 However, Japan's reckless acts will result in putting and tightening the noose around its neck.
					
					 Japan shouldn't forget even a moment that it will come to an end first in return for dancing to the tune of war provocations of its master.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Ridiculed
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Ridiculed
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- CBS of south Korea on Oct. 13 ridiculed the present chief executive for raising the "theory on driver's role" allegedly to settle the situation of the Korean peninsula.
					 Now the situation on the Korean peninsula is reaching to an extreme phase but the authorities are at a loss what to do, it said.
					
					 Denouncing the chief executive for keeping mum at the reckless remarks of Trump escalating the tension of the Korean peninsula, it said that his inability to play a pro-active role in ensuring peace on the Korean peninsula revealed his incompetence.

articles.title: S. Korea: More than Half of Dead Soldiers Are Suicides
articles.content:
S. Korea: More than Half of Dead Soldiers Are Suicides
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- More than half of dead soldiers in south Korean puppet army were suicides, according to the south Korean internet paper E-daily on Oct. 11.
					 It is reported that 289 of 444 soldiers killed within the army in recent five years were suicides and 58 soldiers per year would commit suicide.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "Making Selfless, Devoted Efforts for the Good of the People Is the Mode of Existence and Source of Invincible Might of the Workers' Party of Korea" was brought out in booklet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on October 6 on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the WPK and its 72nd founding anniversary.
					 The work, published on October 10, Juche 104 (2015), says that the history of the WPK is a proud course in which it has led the Korean revolution to victory, being responsible for the people's destiny under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kimjongilia Show Opens in Mongolia
articles.content:
Kimjongilia Show Opens in Mongolia
 Pyongyang, October 16 (KCNA) -- Kimjongilia show took place in Darkhan-Uul Province, Mongolia on Oct. 10 on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and its 72nd founding anniversary.
					 Displayed at the venue of the show were photos dealing with the noble careers and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and those showing the revolutionary exploits of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were hundreds of pots of immortal Kimjongilia, works of the peerlessly great men and books introducing the proud reality of the DPRK.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were figures of various units and masses of Mongolia, the DPRK ambassador to Mongolia and his embassy members and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Then, the participants watched an art performance.

articles.title: Delegacion suiza visita a la RPDC
articles.content:
Delegacion suiza visita a la RPDC
Pyongyang, 16 de octubre (ACNC) -- Por la invitacion del Instituto de Desarme y Paz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, visito desde el dia 12 hasta el 16 a la RPDC la delegacion del Centro de la Politica de Seguridad de Ginebra, Suiza, encabezada por el asesor del Programa de Desarrollo Regional, Alain Guidetti.
					  Durante la estancia, los huespedes suizos se reunieron con los funcionarios del instituto invitante y la Academia de Ciencias Sociales para intercambiar las opiniones sobre los problemas de interes mutuo, incluyendo la situacion actual de la Peninsula Coreana, y visitaron la casa natal del Presidente Kim Il Sung en Mangyongdae, el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, el Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas y otros lugares.

articles.title: Inaugurada exposicion nacional de articulos de consumo popular
articles.content:
Inaugurada exposicion nacional de articulos de consumo popular
Pyongyang, 16 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada en la Tienda Subterranea de Pyongyang la 28a Exposicion Nacional de los Articulos de Consumo Popular.
					En la ocasion se exhibieron mas de 80 mil articulos de mas de 2 mil generos de buena calidad producidos por las fabricas de industria ligera de diferentes localidades y las unidades de elaboracion de los articulos de primera necesidad de las fabricas y empresas adscritas a los ministerios y organos centrales.
					
					Estan planeados durante su jornada la visita a varias fabricas como la Fabrica de Articulos Plasticos de Uso Diario de Ex Militares Minusvalidos de Rangnang, el cursillo de nueva tecnologia y el registro de Articulo de 2 de Febrero.
					
					La ceremonia inaugural tuvo lugar el dia 16 con la participacion del vicepremier Ri Ju O, el ministro de Industria Alimentaria y de Articulos de Uso Diario, Jo Yong Chol, los funcionarios de la rama interesada y de las unidades presentadoras, asi como los cientificos, tecnicos y obreros.
					
					La exhibicion estara abierta hasta el dia 20.

articles.title: Inaugurada la exposicion internacional de muebles y materiales de construccion
articles.content:
Inaugurada la exposicion internacional de muebles y materiales de construccion 
Pyongyang, 16 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada el dia 16 en el Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas la exposicion cientifico-tecnica internacional de muebles y materiales de construccion de Pyongyang.
					  En la ocasion se exhibieron los muebles multifuncionales de gran utilidad y los materiales de construccion verde y funcionales ventajosos a la salud del cuerpo humano y la proteccion del ambiente, presentados por mas de 100 entidades de varios paises y regiones del mundo inclusive la RPDC.
					
					  En la ceremonia inaugural estuvieron presentes los funcionarios, investigadores y profesores de los comites, ministerios, organos centrales, instituciones de ciencia y educacion, unidades relacionadas tales como el Comite de Construccion Capitalina y el Ministerio de Construccion e Industria de Materiales de Construccion, las delegaciones provenientes de varios paises y regiones y los miembros de las representaciones diplomaticas en la RPDC. 
					
					  El discurso de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Choe Jong Ho, rector del Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas. Le siguio a pronunciar las palabras de felicitacion Sim Yong Hak, presidente del Comite Central de la Union de Arquitectos de Corea.
					
					  Los oradores dijeron que el presente encuentro servira de un motivo para intercambiar los exitos y experiencias alcanzados en la rama de muebles y materiales de construccion, intensificar la amistad y cooperacion entre los paises y estimular el desarrollo de nuevas tecnicas y nuevos articulos.
					
					  La exposicion se efectuara hasta el dia 20.

articles.title: Celebran en Corea el Dia Mundial de Alimento
articles.content:
Celebran en Corea el Dia Mundial de Alimento
Pyongyang, 16 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 16 en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang el acto dedicado al Dia Mundial de Alimento.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Ko Myong Hui, viceministra de Agricultura, los funcionarios de ministerios, organos centrales y unidades vinculadas, Tapan Mishra, coordinador permanente de la ONU y representante permanente del Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo en Corea, el vice-representante de la Organizacion de las Naciones Unidas para la Agricultura y la Alimentacion (FAO) en Corea y otros miembros de las representaciones de la FAO el Programa Mundial de Alimento, asi como los miembros de las embajadas de varios paises.
					
					Hubo discursos.
					
					Los oradores dijeron que el presente encuentro sera buena oportunidad para presentar el tema del Dia Mundial de Alimento de este ano y discutir los remedios para resolver de manera sostenible la creciente demanda de los alimentos.
					
					Mencionaron que la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se concentra en la solucion del problema alimentario del pueblo considerandola como mayor prioridad.
					
					Destacaron la necesidad de intensificar el intercambio y cooperacion entre las organizaciones y entidades internacionales en la esfera de produccion agricola.
					
					A continuacion, hubo intervenciones bajo los temas de "Tendencia mundial de agricultura en zonas urbanas", "Estado actual y perspectivas de la aplicacion del sistema de mejoramiento del arroz en terreno humedo en la RPDC", "Tecnica de cultivo de alto rendimiento del trigo otonal".
					
					Con anterioridad, los miembros de las representaciones de la FAO, el PNUD, el PMA y la OMS realizaron el trabajo voluntario en una granja del suburbio capitalino.

articles.title: Tuvo lugar juego otonal de aficionados a la equitacion
articles.content:
Tuvo lugar juego otonal de aficionados a la equitacion
Pyongyang, 16 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 15 en el Club de Equitacion de Mirim el juego otonal de aficionados a la equitacion.
					A la maestranza concurrieron, ademas de los aficionados, los ciudadanos para presenciar el juego.
					
					En la cita deportiva auspiciada por la Asociacion Coreana de Equitadores, tomaron parte los maestrantes y los aficionados.
					
					El juego fue realizado dividido en la recreacion de equitacion, la competencia de tecnicas de control de caballo y la carrera de los aficionados.
					
					En la segunda disciplina, los caballistas manifestaron plenamente sus habilidades ecuestres adiestradas.
					
					En la recreacion y la competencia de tecnicas de control de caballo, efectuadas en el campo de entrenamiento bajo techo, participaron los ninos escolares y jovenes.
					
					La carrera de los aficionados dio jubilo, alegria y optimismo a los concurrentes quienes animaron a los jinetes.
					
					Acto seguido, hubo la loteria de caballo de carrera de los jinetes del Club.
